meta.title: Seminar at Colibri-CRIC, Dschang (17 Feb 2026)
meta.description: I participated as ITASD vice-coordinator in a Colibri-CRIC seminar dedicated to research impact and artificial intelligence.

header.title: Seminar at Colibri-CRIC, Dschang
header.lead: On 17 February 2026, I took part in a seminar hosted at the Colibri Research Center in Dschang, in my role as Vice-Coordinator of ITASD.

image.alt: Conference session at Colibri-CRIC in Dschang

data.text: On 17 February 2026, I joined a special seminar at the Colibri Research Center in Dschang, as [b]Vice-Coordinator of ITASD[/b]. The session addressed a practical question: how to transform research into [u]measurable impact[/u], with a focus on artificial intelligence.

data.legend: Opening discussion during the seminar at Colibri-CRIC (Dschang).

data.text: [color=#0d6adf][b]Colibri-CRIC[/b][/color] is a research and innovation ecosystem focused on creating solutions with social and economic value. [font=heading][b]ITASD[/b][/font], the Institute of Technology and Advanced Science for Sustainable Development, is one of the institutes within this ecosystem and hosted this seminar.

items: [b]Mission alignment[/b]: connecting science, technology, and sustainable development priorities.
[b]Action orientation[/b]: encouraging outcomes that are useful for institutions, communities, and industry.
[b]Collaboration model[/b]: building bridges between research teams, practitioners, and decision-makers.
Impact should be planned from project design, not only discussed at publication stage.
AI projects need clear problem framing, data quality discipline, and responsible governance.
Interdisciplinary collaboration is essential to move from prototypes to field-level adoption.
Evidence of value should combine scientific outputs with concrete societal or organizational outcomes.

images.alt: Speaker and audience during the seminar
images.caption: Opening exchange with participants

data.text: A fuller event recap is available in the Colibri-CRIC post: [Retour en images](https://colibri-cric.org/blog/2026/02/19/retour-en-images-sur-la-conference-speciale-faire-de-la-recherche-a-limpact-focus-sur-lintelligence-artificielle-animee-par-samuel-fosso-wamba/). This seminar was an important milestone for my engagement in impact-oriented research activities through ITASD.
